intro: Seseli karatavicum, commonly known as Karatavicum seseli, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually pale green to white, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Seseli karatavicum is often found in mountainous regions and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche.
